subject: Mental Health
title: How Anxiety Feels in the Body
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on How Anxiety Feels in the Body.

hook.text: Anxiety doesn't just live in your head. It shows up as chest pain, nausea, and dizziness.

buildup.text: Muscles tense, breathing speeds up, and digestion slows as blood rushes to limbs.

discovery.text: These are real physical symptoms caused by the nervous system preparing for danger.

twist.text: Many people visit the ER for a heart attack that turns out to be a panic attack.

climax.text: Body sensations then trigger more anxiety, creating a self-reinforcing loop.

punchline.text: Your body believes the threat your mind invented.

quiz.question: Why do panic attacks often mimic heart attacks?
options: The nervous system causes real physical symptoms
